questions.question: What aspect of the lives of hunter-gatherers does the image illustrate?

choices.answer: Hunter-gatherers followed certain paths for trade.
Hunter-gatherers depended on hunting for food
Hunter-gatherers relied on technology to make tools

questions.question: Historians think that women were major contributors to specific areas of Neolithic life. What were the two main areas?

choices.answer: serving as family and community leaders
overseeing food supplies and weaving textiles
painting and working in the fields

questions.question: The relationship between changes to the physical landscape & the development of agriculture after the last Ice age?

choices.answer: Nomads continued migrating to other regions following herds of animals.
Climate changes led people to move further north and south from the Equator.
The cold temperatures forced people to change their way of life and adapt t
Mild climate and fertile land allowed farming to replace hunting and gather

questions.question: How did the advancement of basic tools eventually lead to advances in agriculture?

choices.answer: Civilizations could be conquered with weapons
The types of tools developed determined where people settled
Smaller and more refined tools could be made using basic tools
Hunting became easier through the use of tools

questions.question: How were early farmers different from hunter-gatherers?

choices.answer: They often changed their physical location.
They usually lived in small bands of 20–30 people
They domesticated animals for human use
They ate all the grains that they collected

questions.question: What benefit did early humans gain by settling in agricultural communities?

choices.answer: benefited from less sickness and enjoyed more free time
developed religious beliefs which led to permanent houses of worship
able to expand territory to find new food sources for hunting and gathering
became more adaptable and had more natural resources available

questions.question: A mixture of copper and tin is called
Times of extreme cold when great sheets of ice covered parts of the Earth were the
Paleolithic people What?

choices.answer: used copper and bronze to make tools
crafted simple tools such as axes

questions.question: Men in the Neolithic Age did what?

choices.answer: herded, farmed, and protected the village

questions.question: Why was the discovery of bronze an important breakthrough at the end of the Neolithic Age?

choices.answer: Bronze was more affordable than copper
Bronze was more abundant than copper.
Bronze was more attractive than copper.

questions.question: Because the conditions for farming were suitable, the first civilizations arose
What was the most important and long-lasting effect the Agricultural Revolution?

choices.answer: The population grew at a faster rate, and people settled into communities
People completely stopped hunting and gathering
New types of stone tools were made

questions.question: As food became more abundant, fewer people were needed in the fields. As a result, some people

choices.answer: went back to hunting and gathering

questions.question: What do historians call the general early period of human history?
Determine the best example of how an advance in the use of technology made life less difficult

choices.answer: They discovered how to use fire

questions.question: Recall the advancement during the Paleolithic Age that made gathering food easier.
What advancement during the Paleolithic Age made communication between people easier?

choices.answer: the discovery that crushed rock and animal that makes paint
